intro: Leiphaimos simplex, commonly known as the simple leiphaimos, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants known for their ornamental value. The plant features small, clustered white flowers that bloom during the late spring and early summer. Its leaves are simple, oval-shaped, and have a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
